oai_dc:dc.dc:title: In situ measurement of pH in the interior of conducting polymer microtubules
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: NATH, ARCHANA
KANUNGO, MANDAKINI
CONTRACTOR, AQ
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: oxidation
plastic films
polymers
ph effects
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Visible spectral absorption studies of an indicator trapped in the microenvironment of polypyrrole (PPY) and polyaniline (PANI) films were used to investigate the change in pH accompanying changes in oxidation state of the polymer. An indicator, bromophenol blue was incorporated in the conducting polymer film during the electropolymerization process. In situ UVâ€“vis spectra of these films were recorded in aqueous solution of KCl. The results obtained show that with increasing potential of the film, the pH of the microenvironment decreases both for PPY and PANI. The change in pH is greater in the potential range where the change in electronic conductivity is also greater.
